com.miviclin.droidengine2d.gamestate

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.miviclin.droidengine2d.gamestate.GameState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameStateAdapter

    public abstract class GameState
extends Object
    GameState represents a level, menu, screen... of the game.
    GameStates should be initialized in AbstractGame.initialize() or in another GameState.
    Author:
    Miguel Vicente Linares

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameState(Game game)
      Creates a new GameState.
      GameState(GameStateInputManager gameStateInputManager, Game game)
      Creates a new GameState.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose()
      Calls onDispose() to dispose this GameState.
      abstract void draw(Graphics g)
      Renders the game objects of this GameState.
      Activity getActivity()
      Returns the Activity where the game runs.
      Camera getCamera()
      Returns the Camera.
      Game getGame()
      Returns the Game this GameState belongs to.
      GameStateInputManager getGameStateInputManager()
      Returns the GameInputManager.
      GameStateManager getGameStateManager()
      Returns the GameStateManager.
      TextureManager getTextureManager()
      Returns the TextureManager.
      abstract void onActivation()
      This method is called when this GameState is pushed onto the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.
      abstract void onDeactivation()
      This method is called when this GameState is popped off the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.
      abstract void onDispose()
      All resources should be released in this method.
      abstract void onPause()
      This method is called when GameStateManager.pause() is called, if this GameState is in the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.
      abstract void onRegister()
      This method is called when this GameState is registered in the GameStateManager.
      abstract void onResume()
      This method is called when GameStateManager.resume() is called, if this GameState is the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.
      abstract void update(float delta)
      Updates this GameState.

        Returns:
        GameInputManager

      • dispose

        public final void dispose()
        Calls onDispose() to dispose this GameState.
        This method is called automatically when this GameState is unregistered from the GameStateManager calling GameStateManager.unregisterGameState(int) or when GameStateManager.dispose() is called.

      • update

        public abstract void update(float delta)
        Updates this GameState.
        This method is called from GameStateManager.update(float) if this GameState is registered in the GameStateManager.
        Parameters:
        delta - Elapsed time, in milliseconds, since the last update.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(Graphics g)
        Renders the game objects of this GameState.
        This method is called from GameStateManager.draw(Graphics) if this GameState is registered in the GameStateManager.
        This method is called from the redering thread after update(float) has been executed in the game thread.

      • onRegister

        public abstract void onRegister()
        This method is called when this GameState is registered in the GameStateManager.
        Any initialization should be performed here.

      • onActivation

        public abstract void onActivation()
        This method is called when this GameState is pushed onto the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.

      • onDeactivation

        public abstract void onDeactivation()
        This method is called when this GameState is popped off the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.

      • onPause

        public abstract void onPause()
        This method is called when GameStateManager.pause() is called, if this GameState is in the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.

      • onResume

        public abstract void onResume()
        This method is called when GameStateManager.resume() is called, if this GameState is the stack of active GameStates of the GameStateManager.

      • onDispose

        public abstract void onDispose()
        All resources should be released in this method.
        This method is called from dispose().
